samples.input: Extract from the text the main characteristics of the city of São Paulo. Separate them with a comma. São Paulo is the most populous city in Brazil, and is the capital of the state of São Paulo, the most populous and wealthiest Brazilian state, located in the country's Southeast Region. Listed by the GaWC as an alpha global city, São Paulo is the most populous city proper in the Americas, the Western Hemisphere, and the Southern Hemisphere, as well as the world's 4th largest city proper by population. Additionally, São Paulo is the largest Portuguese-speaking city in the world. It exerts strong international influences in commerce, finance, arts and entertainment. The city's name honors the Apostle, Saint Paul of Tarsus. The city's metropolitan area, the Greater São Paulo, ranks as the most populous in Brazil and the 12th most populous on Earth. The process of conurbation between the metropolitan areas around the Greater São Paulo (Campinas, Santos, Jundiaí, Sorocaba and São José dos Campos) created the São Paulo Macrometropolis, a megalopolis with more than 30 million inhabitants, one of the most populous urban agglomerations in the world.

samples.instruction: Extract from the text what are the details needed for a  subledger, or subsidiary ledger. Separate them by a comma.
samples.input:
Extract from the text what are the details needed for a  subledger, or subsidiary ledger. Separate them by a comma. The subledger, or subsidiary ledger, provides details behind entries in the general ledger used in accounting. The subledger shows detail for part of the accounting records such as property and equipment, prepaid expenses, etc. The detail would include such items as date the item was purchased or expense incurred, a description of the item, the original balance, and the net book value. The total of the subledger would match the line item amount on the general ledger. This corresponding line item in the general ledger is referred to as the controlling account. The subsidiary ledger balance is compared with its controlling account balance as part of the process of preparing a trial balance.

As part of an audit, a method of testing balances may include tracing individual acquisitions to the subsidiary ledger for amounts and descriptions. The objective of this test is to determine that the current-year acquisitions schedule agrees with related subledger amounts, and the total agrees with the general ledger.
samples.output: date the item was purchased, expense incurred, description of the item, original balance, net book value

In total, the main channel is approximately 77 miles (124 km) in length, and the watershed drains approximately 380 square miles (980 km2).

samples.instruction: Extract from the text the events won by the Kawasaki KX 500 motorcycle, and separate them by a comma.
samples.input:
Extract from the text the events won by the Kawasaki KX 500 motorcycle, and separate them by a comma. The Kawasaki KX 500 is a 499 cc (30.5 cu in) two-stroke single motocross motorcycle made by Kawasaki from 1983 until 2004.

The Kawasaki KX500 was developed as an air-cooled 500cc motocross bike for competition in the 500cc and Open-Class of motocross. At the time of its release, several top manufactured sported entries in this class, including Yamaha, Suzuki, Honda and the class-leading Maico.

Kawasaki developed the bike on an annual basis through the 80's. The addition of liquid cooling in 1985, a new frame with improved suspension in 1987, engine updates in 1988 and reversed forks in 1990 highlight these revisions.

Kawasaki would take several years to produce a competitive bike, and when it finally did, would find the KX500 winning in events for which it was not initially designed for. Its first victories came in 1986, when Donnie Griewe won two National Hare and Hound events. These only foreshadowed Kawasaki's dominance in distance and desert racing that exploded in the 90's.

In 1989 Kawasaki captures its first National MX championship on a KX500, repeating in '90 and '92 before the series was discontinued at the close of the '93 season. But that would not be the end of the KX500's racing legacy.

Beginning in 1992, the KX500 took the victory in every Desert Nationals race through 1995, and continued to win the Desert Nationals Championship every year though 2001. It further cemented its legendary dominance in desert racing by being the victors bike at the Baja 1000 from 1988 through 1996.
samples.output: National Hare and Hound, National MX championship, Desert Nationals, Baja 1000

samples.instruction: Extract from the text the method encouraged to use in Apache Spark.
samples.input: Extract from the text the method encouraged to use in Apache Spark. Apache Spark has its architectural foundation in the resilient distributed dataset (RDD), a read-only multiset of data items distributed over a cluster of machines, that is maintained in a fault-tolerant way. The Dataframe API was released as an abstraction on top of the RDD, followed by the Dataset API. In Spark 1.x, the RDD was the primary application programming interface (API), but as of Spark 2.x use of the Dataset API is encouraged even though the RDD API is not deprecated. The RDD technology still underlies the Dataset API.
samples.output: Dataset API

samples.instruction: What does it mean for something to be compostable?

In contrast, concrete concepts, ideas, or objects can be described or verified through observation, empirical evidence, or sensory experience.

samples.instruction: What does it mean when something is described as "the tail wagging the dog?"
samples.input:
What does it mean when something is described as "the tail wagging the dog?"

Output:
samples.output: Sentence: In the United Kingdom, the House of Lords was historically the most powerful part of Parliament, but since 1911 it has been subordinate to the House of Commons. The Lords are still able to delay legislation and occasionally force the Commons to change proposed laws. However, the Commons has the power to reject these amendments outright if they choose to do so. This arrangement has led to the phrase "the tail wagging the dog", describing the Lords' apparent ability to influence the government despite their actual lack of power.

samples.output: Paragraph: The wolf in sheep's clothing is a metaphor for people who disguise themselves as harmless, kind and honest but are actually dangerous, cruel and dishonest.

samples.instruction: What does it mean when something is described as "the tail wagging the dog?"
samples.input: What does it mean when something is described as "the tail wagging the dog?"
samples.output: Paragraph: The tail wagging the dog is a metaphor used to describe a situation in which the tail (or some other extremity) of an animal appears to be leading the rest of its body, when in fact the opposite is true. It is often used to describe situations where a small group or organization dominates a much larger one.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm 5 ways to reduce stress.
samples.input: Brainstorm 5 ways to reduce stress.
samples.output:
1. Exercise regularly: Physical activity has been shown to increase the release of endorphins, which can improve mood and reduce feelings of stress and anxiety.

2. Practice relaxation techniques: Techniques such as deep breathing, meditation, and visualization can help to activate the body's relaxation response and reduce feelings of stress.

3. Get enough sleep: Lack of sleep can exacerbate feelings of stress and anxiety. Aim for at least seven to eight hours of quality sleep each night.

4. Manage time effectively: Being overwhelmed with too many tasks and responsibilities can lead to feelings of stress. Prioritize your tasks, set achievable goals, and delegate when possible to help manage your time more effectively.

5. Connect with others: Social support from friends, family, and colleagues can help to reduce feelings of stress. Make time for social activities and meaningful relationships in your life.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm different ways to cook a specific type of food.
samples.input: Brainstorm different ways to cook a specific type of food. Pork chops
samples.output:
1. **Breaded:** Coat the pork chops in seasoned breadcrumbs and bake or fry until crispy and golden brown.

2. **Grilled:** Marinate the pork chops and grill for a smoky flavor.

3. **Pan-seared:** Heat a skillet with melted butter or oil and cook the pork chops on each side for delicious, caramelized results.

4. **Slow-cooked:** Place pork chops in a slow cooker with your favorite sauce, vegetables, or spices and cook low and slow for tender and succulent results.

5. **Broiled:** Season pork chops and broil in a preheated oven for a quick and easy meal.

6. **Baked:** Place pork chops in a baking dish with your favorite herbs and spices and bake until fully cooked.

7. **Sous-vide:** Cook pork chops in a precisely controlled water bath set to the desired temperature, then finish with a quick sear for a perfectly cooked chop.

8. **Stuffed:** Create a pocket in the pork chop and stuff it with a mixture of cheese, vegetables, or fruits before cooking.

9. **Barbecued:** Baste pork chops with your favorite BBQ sauce and cook on a grill or stovetop for a tasty and flavorful treat.

10. **Smoked:** Infuse deep smoky flavors into the pork chop by cooking low and slow in a smoker.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm ways of improving the customer experience
samples.input: Brainstorm ways of improving the customer experience
samples.output:
1. Personalization: Personalize customer experience by keeping track of customer preferences, purchase history, and behavior to create a more tailored approach to interactions with them.

2. Prompt response: Provide prompt responses to customer inquiries and concerns, thereby reducing frustration and increasing satisfaction.

3. Multichannel support: Offer multiple channels of communication for customers to reach out for help, such as phone, email, live chat, social media, among others.

4. Offer self-service options: Provide customers with self-service options such as an FAQ page, chatbot, or knowledge base that can be accessed anytime, anywhere to quickly resolve common issues.

5. Empower employees: Ensure that employees are well-trained, knowledgeable about products and services, and empowered to make decisions that can improve customer experience.

6. Streamline processes: Simplify and streamline processes to reduce the time customers wait for resolution, delivery, or any other services.

7. Proactively seek feedback: Actively seek customer feedback and use it to improve and enhance the customer experience.

8. Loyalty programs: Implement loyalty programs to reward customers for their loyalty, and provide incentives for them to continue doing business with the company.

9. Surprise and delight: Occasionally surprise customers with unexpected gestures of appreciation, such as discounts or gifts, to make them feel valued and appreciated.

10. Follow up: Follow up with customers after a purchase or interaction to ensure they are satisfied and address any concerns they may have. This helps to build long-term relationships and foster customer loyalty.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm 5 ways to reduce waste in an office.
samples.input: Brainstorm 5 ways to reduce waste in an office.
samples.output:
1. Implementing a paperless document system: One of the most effective ways to reduce waste in an office is to transition to a paperless document system. By utilizing digital communication and electronic storage solutions, businesses can dramatically reduce their paper consumption, resulting in less waste and clutter.

2. Encouraging the use of reusable containers: Another way to reduce waste is to encourage employees to bring their lunches in reusable containers instead of disposable bags or boxes. This will not only reduce the amount of waste generated in the office, but will also promote healthier and more sustainable habits among employees.

3. Setting up a recycling system: Setting up a recycling system in the office can help to divert waste from landfills and promote more environmentally-friendly practices among employees. Encourage employees to recycle paper, plastics, glass, and metal containers, and make sure there are clearly-marked recycling bins in convenient locations throughout the office.

4. Utilizing energy-efficient technology: Waste reduction doesn't only apply to materials and tangible items. By incorporating energy-efficient technology such as LED lighting, programmable thermostats, and energy-saving devices, offices can greatly reduce their energy consumption and waste.

5. Educating employees on waste reduction: Educating employees on the importance of reducing waste and implementing sustainable practices is crucial for creating a more environmentally-friendly workplace. Encourage employees to adopt sustainable practices such as turning off electronics when not in use, reducing paper usage, and composting food waste. The more aware employees are of the importance of reducing waste, the more likely they are to adopt these behaviors in their daily routines.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm some ways to repurpose the given object.
samples.input: Brainstorm some ways to repurpose the given object. Old T-shirt
samples.output:
1. Turn it into a reusable shopping bag: Cut off the sleeves and sew the bottom of the shirt closed, and you have an easy-to-make tote bag.
2. Create a DIY dog toy by braiding strips of the shirt together and knotting the ends.
3. Make a rag rug by cutting the t-shirt into strips and weaving them together.
4. Fashion a produce bag for grocery shopping by cutting off the sleeves and neckline, and tying the bottom closed with a shirt strip.
5. Make headbands or hair ties by cutting the shirt into thin strips and wrapping around your head or hair.
6. Make a pillowcase by sewing two shirts together, leaving one side open to insert a pillow.
7. Create cleaning rags by cutting the shirt into squares and using them to clean surfaces, wash dishes or dust furniture.
8. Make a quilt or blanket from several old t-shirts by sewing the squares together and adding batting in between.
9. Make a scarf by cutting the shirt into thin strips and attaching them together in a loop.
10. Create padded hangers by wrapping strips of the shirt around the hanger and securing the ends.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm some creative ways to celebrate someone's milestone birthday.
samples.input: Brainstorm some creative ways to celebrate someone's milestone birthday.
samples.output:
1. Surprise Road Trip: Plan a surprise road trip to a beautiful and scenic location that the birthday person has always wanted to visit.

2. Themed Birthday Party: Organize a themed birthday party that matches the birthday person’s interests, hobbies, or favorite movies and shows.

3. Personalized Gift: Create a customized gift with special meaning such as a photo album or collage of memories, artwork, or a piece of jewelry.

4. Adventure activity: Gift them an adventurous experience such as skydiving, bungee jumping, or a hot air balloon ride.

5. Video montage: Create a video montage of people close to the birthday person sharing their favorite memories, messages or even singing them a happy birthday song.

6. Special dinner: Organize a special dinner at their favorite restaurant or hire a personal chef to prepare a meal at their home.

7. Photoshoot session: Book a professional photoshoot session to capture the essence of their milestone birthday and create memories that last a lifetime.

8. A day of pampering: Treat them to a day of pampering and relaxation with a spa package, massage, or beauty treatment.

9. Charity donation: Make a donation in their name to a charity that is close to their heart and let them know how their milestone birthday has helped others.

10. Concert or show: Take them to see their favorite band, musician, or a play, musical or show that they have been wanting to see.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm ways to reduce energy consumption in a home.
samples.input: Brainstorm ways to reduce energy consumption in a home.
samples.output:
1. Unplug electronics and appliances when not in use to avoid standby power usage.
2. Switch to energy-efficient LED light bulbs and turn off lights when leaving a room.
3. Use a programmable thermostat to regulate heating and cooling, and set it to a lower temperature at night or when you’re away from home.
4. Wash clothes in cold water and hang them to dry rather than using a dryer.
5. Insulate your home properly to reduce heat loss and save on heating costs.
6. Use smart power strips to control the power usage of multiple devices at once.
7. Install low-flow showerheads and faucets to reduce water usage.
8. Upgrade to energy-efficient appliances and electronics, such as ENERGY STAR certified products.
9. Plant trees or install shading devices to block direct sunlight on windows during hot summer days.
10. Use public transportation, carpool, bike or walk instead of driving alone to reduce your carbon footprint.
11. Consider switching to renewable energy sources like solar or wind power to reduce your reliance on nonrenewable energy sources.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm one way to reduce household waste.
samples.input: Brainstorm one way to reduce household waste.
samples.output: One way to reduce household waste is by composting. Composting involves taking organic waste, such as food scraps, yard waste, and paper products and allowing them to decompose in a designated compost bin or pile. Instead of throwing these materials away, they are transformed into a nutrient-rich soil that can be used to grow plants, fertilize gardens, and improve soil quality. This not only reduces the amount of waste sent to landfills, but also benefits the environment by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and helping to restore depleted soils.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm 3 ways to reduce noise pollution.
samples.input: Brainstorm 3 ways to reduce noise pollution.
samples.output:
1. Use of noise barriers: Human-made or natural barriers, such as walls or shrubs, can serve as effective ways to reduce noise pollution. These barriers absorb sounds and prevent them from traveling further. Placing such barriers along busy roads or highways, around construction sites or industrial areas can help minimize noise pollution.

2. Regulating sources of noise: Governments can introduce stricter regulations to limit and control the noise levels produced by sources such as traffic, construction work, airplanes, and industrial work. Speed limits and designated quiet zones in residential areas, time restrictions on construction work, and stricter airplane noise regulations are all effective ways to reduce noise pollution.

3. Promoting awareness: Raising public awareness about the harmful effects of noise pollution and educating people about how they can help minimize it can also be a successful approach. For instance, encouraging people to avoid honking unnecessarily while driving, to use public transport or carpool more, and to use quieter equipment and machinery at home or work can all contribute towards reducing noise pollution.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm three creative and unique ways to decorate a room.
samples.input: Brainstorm three creative and unique ways to decorate a room.
samples.output:
1. Create an accent wall with a personalized mural: A mural can add a unique touch to any room and serve as a statement piece. You could hire an artist to paint something that represents your personality, a landscape, or an abstract design. This will surely turn a bland room into a vibrant space.

2. Use lighting creatively: Lighting can make a significant impact in the decor of a room. Instead of regular lamps, use string lights or neon signs to outline furniture, or create a lighted canopy for a cozy and dreamy effect. You can also add a large sculptural light fixture as a centerpiece for the room.

3. Create a green oasis: Bring life and freshness to your room by adding plants in various sizes, shapes and colors. You can use hanging planters, shelves, or a plant wall to create a lush indoor garden. Not only do plants instantly change the look of a room, but they also help clean the air, and bring a sense of calm and well-being.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm 3 creative ways to use an old tablecloth
samples.input: Brainstorm 3 creative ways to use an old tablecloth
samples.output:
1. **Make a picnic blanket:** Old tablecloths can be transformed into a stylish and functional picnic blanket. All you need to do is lay the cloth out flat, add a layer of batting or foam for cushioning, then sew or hot glue another piece of fabric on the back. This will create a comfortable and waterproof surface that’s perfect for a day out at the park.

2. **Sew tote bags:** With a bit of sewing skills, you can turn an old tablecloth into a series of cute and practical tote bags. Simply cut out squares or rectangles of the fabric, fold them in half, and sew the sides together. Then, add handles using strips of the same material or a coordinating ribbon. These totes can be used for grocery shopping, as beach bags, or for any other purpose where a sturdy and reusable bag comes in handy.

3. **Create a photo backdrop:** Photographers are always in search of unique and interesting backdrops for their shoots. If your old tablecloth features a pretty pattern or a bold graphic print, you could use it as a backdrop for portrait or product photography. Simply hang the cloth on a wall or drape it over a portable frame, then snap away. With a bit of editing, you’ll have professional-looking photos that are sure to impress.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm 3 innovative ways to use machine learning.
samples.input: Brainstorm 3 innovative ways to use machine learning.
samples.output:
1. Personalized Healthcare: Machine learning can be used to develop personalized treatment plans for patients based on their medical history, genetics, and lifestyle. This will involve analyzing large amounts of medical data to identify patterns and correlations that can help predict the effectiveness of different treatments for specific individuals. By taking into account the unique needs and characteristics of each patient, healthcare providers can provide more targeted and effective care.

2. Predictive Maintenance: Machine learning can be applied to predict equipment failures before they occur, allowing for preventative maintenance to be scheduled, thereby reducing downtime and costs. This can be achieved by analyzing sensor data from machines and using predictive algorithms to identify patterns that are indicative of potential failures. This technology has the potential to revolutionize industries that rely on heavy machinery, such as manufacturing, transportation, and construction.

3. Intelligent Energy Management: Machine learning can be used to optimize energy usage in buildings, reducing waste and improving efficiency. This involves analyzing data from building automation systems, weather forecasts, and occupancy patterns to identify areas for improvement and develop algorithms that can automatically adjust temperature, lighting, and ventilation to maximize energy efficiency. This technology can have a significant impact on reducing carbon emissions and mitigating the effects of climate change.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm three ways to update the given product design.
samples.input: Brainstorm three ways to update the given product design. A fishing rod
samples.output:
1. Adding sensor technology: Incorporating sensors into the design of the fishing rod can help anglers detect when a fish is biting, the type of fish, depth of water, and the temperature of the water.

2. Enhancing portability: The fishing rod can be updated to include features like collapsibility and lightweight materials to improve its portability, making it easier for users to travel with the fishing rod to different fishing locations.

3. Improving ergonomics: The handle and grip of the fishing rod can be updated for comfort during long periods of use. Materials that provide a better grip, reduce fatigue, and minimize strain on the user's hands, wrists, and arms can be incorporated into the design.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm five different ways to improve the environment.
samples.input: Brainstorm five different ways to improve the environment.
samples.output:
There are several ways to improve the environment and make it more sustainable for future generations. Here are five possible solutions:

1. Reduce Emissions: One of the most effective ways to improve the environment is to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. This can be done by increasing the use of renewable energy sources like solar, wind, and geothermal power, and reducing dependence on fossil fuels.

2. Conserve Resources: Conservation strategies like recycling and reducing waste can help to preserve natural resources and reduce the strain on the environment. This can include composting, reusing packaging materials, and reducing the use of single-use plastics.

3. Plant More Trees: Trees play a vital role in maintaining the earth's ecosystem, so planting more trees and protecting forests is a great way to help the environment. Trees absorb carbon dioxide, provide shade, and help to prevent soil erosion.

4. Promote Sustainable Agriculture: The way food is produced can have a significant impact on the environment. Sustainable agriculture practices like crop rotation, using natural pest control methods, and reducing water usage can help to decrease the burden on the environment.

5. Encourage Energy Efficiency: Making homes, buildings, and transportation more energy-efficient can reduce greenhouse gas emissions and reduce the demand for energy from non-renewable sources. This can include using energy-efficient appliances, improving insulation, and using public transportation or fuel-efficient vehicles.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm ways to reduce water waste.
samples.input: Brainstorm ways to reduce water waste.
samples.output:
1. Fix leaks: Leaky taps, pipes and toilets can waste large amounts of water over time. Regular maintenance and repairs can help to reduce water waste.

2. Use efficient appliances: Water-efficient appliances such as washing machines, dishwashers and low-flush toilets can help to reduce water usage in the home.

3. Reduce shower time: Taking shorter showers can significantly reduce water usage. Encouraging all household members to keep showers to five minutes or less is a simple way to save water.

4. Collect rainwater: Collecting and using rainwater for watering plants, washing cars or flushing toilets can help to reduce the demand on the main water supply.

5. Don't leave the tap running: Simple habits like turning off the tap while brushing teeth or shaving can save a lot of water. Filling up a basin or sink with water instead of letting the tap run is another way to reduce waste.

6. Water plants wisely: Watering plants in the early morning or late evening reduces evaporation, meaning that more water is absorbed by the plants. Drip irrigation systems can also be more efficient than sprinklers, as they deliver water directly to the roots.

7. Use mulch: Mulching around plants helps to retain moisture in the soil, reducing the need for frequent watering.

8. Recycle water: Using greywater from showers, baths and washing machines to water plants or flush toilets can help to reduce water waste.

9. Educate others: Raising awareness about the importance of water conservation and the simple steps that can be taken to reduce water waste can help to make a big difference in the community.

10. Support conservation efforts: Supporting initiatives and organizations that work to protect water resources and promote sustainable water usage can help to ensure that there is enough water for everyone, now and in the future.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm five different ways to ask someone on a date.
samples.input: Brainstorm five different ways to ask someone on a date.
samples.output:
1. Would you like to go on a date with me this weekend?
2. How do you feel about me taking you out for dinner and a movie?
3. I know a great spot for a romantic picnic, would you like to join me?
4. I would love to spend an evening with you, perhaps going to a concert or show, are you interested?
5. There’s an exhibition in town that I think you’d enjoy, how about we make a date out of it and grab some coffee afterwards?

samples.instruction: Brainstorm five ways to surprise your partner for their birthday.
samples.input: Brainstorm five ways to surprise your partner for their birthday.
samples.output:
1. Plan a surprise birthday trip: You can secretly plan a trip to one of your partner's favorite destinations or a place they've always wanted to visit. Take care of all the arrangements and reveal the surprise just before you leave.

2. Throw a surprise party: Invite all of their friends, family, and co-workers for a surprise birthday party. Decorate the place with balloons and pictures, and organize games and activities that they will enjoy.

3. Create a memory book: Gather photos, tickets, souvenirs, and any other memorabilia that you've collected throughout your relationship and create a memory book or scrapbook. Give it to your partner as a thoughtful and sentimental birthday gift.

4. Organize a treasure hunt: Create a treasure hunt game where your partner has to follow a series of clues, leading them to different places around the city, where they are presented with small gifts or experiences. The final clue can lead them to their main birthday present.

5. Plan a day of pampering: Arrange a day of relaxation and pampering for your partner. Treat them to a spa day or book them a massage or beauty treatment. Follow it up with a romantic dinner at their favorite restaurant or cook them a special meal at home.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm two innovative ways of using AI for agriculture.
samples.input: Brainstorm two innovative ways of using AI for agriculture.
samples.output:
1. AI-powered Crop Monitoring and Management: One innovative way AI could be used in agriculture is through the implementation of smart crop monitoring and management systems. Using a combination of sensors, drones, and machine learning algorithms, AI could help farmers collect and analyze large amounts of data about their crops, including information on soil composition, weather conditions, and plant health. With this data, the system would be able to recommend the best times for planting, watering, and harvesting, as well as identifying potential diseases or pest infestations and recommending appropriate interventions. This would not only improve crop yields and reduce losses, but also help farmers reduce their environmental impact by optimizing resource usage.

2. AI-assisted Sustainable Livestock Farming: Another innovative use of AI in agriculture is through the development of intelligent livestock farming systems. Using a combination of sensors, machine vision, and machine learning algorithms, AI could help farmers monitor their animals' health, behavior, and well-being in real-time. By analyzing data on feed intake, activity levels, and other health indicators, an AI system could alert farmers to any potential health concerns, help optimize feeding and breeding strategies, and even predict the likelihood of disease outbreaks. This would not only improve animal welfare, but also enable farmers to practice more sustainable and efficient livestock farming, reducing their environmental impact, and improving profitability.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm ways that technology has impacted our daily lives.
samples.input: Brainstorm ways that technology has impacted our daily lives.
samples.output:
1. Communication: Technology has revolutionized the way we communicate, making it faster and more convenient to connect with others anywhere in the world through email, social media, instant messaging and video calls.

2. Entertainment: Technology has changed the way we consume media, with streaming services giving us instant access to movies, TV shows and music, and gaming platforms providing interactive experiences unlike anything we could have imagined in the past.

3. Transportation: Technological advancements have made transportation more efficient and reliable, with navigation systems guiding us to our destinations, ride-sharing apps making it easy to arrange transportation and electric vehicles reducing our carbon footprint.

4. Health and medicine: Technology has greatly impacted healthcare, from electronic medical records to telemedicine, providing patients with more options to manage their health and improving the speed and accuracy of diagnoses and treatments.

5. Education: With the rise of online learning platforms and educational apps, technology has made education more accessible to people of all ages and from all parts of the world, allowing for flexible and customized learning experiences.

6. Productivity and time management: Technology has improved our productivity and time management through the use of task lists and project management software, virtual meetings and collaborations tools, and digital time tracking and scheduling.

7. Shopping and commerce: Technology has made shopping and commerce more convenient, with online marketplaces and e-commerce platforms allowing us to purchase goods and services from the comfort of our homes, and with speedy delivery services and secure payment options, online shopping is now a preferred way to shop for many people.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm three ways for a family to conserve energy.
samples.input: Brainstorm three ways for a family to conserve energy.
samples.output:
1. One way for a family to conserve energy is by making sure to turn off lights, appliances or electronics when they're not in use. Additionally, using power strips to control multiple devices at once and unplugging devices, such as phone chargers, when not in use can help prevent phantom energy usage.

2. Another way is to prioritize energy efficient products when replacing or purchasing household items such as LED lightbulbs, Energy Star certified appliances, and efficient heating or cooling systems which consume less energy in comparison to their counterparts--thus reducing the overall energy use of the household.

3. A third way to conserve energy is to make changes to the household routines, like reducing shower times, washing clothes in cold water, and air drying clothes instead of using a dryer. These small lifestyle changes can significantly reduce the amount of energy consumed daily by the family.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm five ways to reduce emissions from transportation.
samples.input: Brainstorm five ways to reduce emissions from transportation.
samples.output:
1. Promote and Invest in Public Transport: Encourage the use of public transportation such as buses, trains, or subways, as they create fewer emissions per person than single-occupancy vehicles. Investing in a well-connected, efficient and affordable public transportation system can help reduce dependence on personal vehicles.

2. Support Active Transportation: Promoting and providing infrastructure for active transportation such as walking, cycling, or utilizing an electric scooter can drastically reduce transportation emissions. Building bike lanes, pedestrian pathways, and implementing bike-share programs can help facilitate this shift.

3. Encourage Carpooling: Carpooling, ride-sharing or vanpooling can significantly reduce the number of cars on the road, leading to a reduction in emissions. Supporting and promoting carpooling initiatives, as well as implementing carpool lanes, can help incentivize drivers to share their rides.

4. Electrification of Vehicles: Supporting the shift to electric vehicles (EVs) can help reduce transportation emissions as they produce zero tailpipe emissions. Investing in EV charging infrastructure and offering incentives for EV purchases can boost adoption.

5. Implement Emissions Standards: Implementing and enforcing strict emissions standards for vehicles can help reduce emissions from transportation, as manufacturers will be required to produce more efficient and less polluting vehicles. This can be complemented by programs that incentivize drivers to retire older, more polluting vehicles in favor of newer, more efficient ones.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm 3 ways in which a bridge can be made stronger
samples.input: Brainstorm 3 ways in which a bridge can be made stronger
samples.output:
1. Material Selection: Using stronger, more durable materials such as high-strength concrete or steel can greatly improve the strength of a bridge. These materials are resistant to weathering and corrosion and can effectively handle the heavy load that the bridge is subjected to.

2. Design: The design and structure of the bridge can also greatly affect its strength. Utilizing efficient design principles such as incorporating arches, suspension cables, or trusses can help distribute weight more evenly and provide the bridge with the necessary support.

3. Reinforcement: Adding extra reinforcement within the bridge's structure, such as steel reinforcement bars, can also help make the bridge stronger. These bars can help absorb the stress of the load that the bridge is supporting, preventing cracks or damage to the bridge.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm five ways to become a better listener.
samples.input: Brainstorm five ways to become a better listener.
samples.output:
1. **Focus on the speaker:** Give the speaker your full attention, by maintaining eye contact and avoiding any distractions such as your phone or computer.

2. **Practice active listening**: Listen carefully to what the speaker is saying and show that you are engaged by nodding, asking clarifying questions and paraphrasing what they said to ensure you fully understand their message.

3. **Be patient:** Allow the speaker to finish their thoughts without interrupting them. Sometimes people need time to gather their thoughts and it’s important to respect their pace.

4. **Avoid judgment:** Keep an open mind and try not to judge or jump to conclusions. This allows the speaker to feel safe sharing their thoughts and feelings with you. 

5. **Be empathetic:** Try to understand the speaker's perspective and feelings. Put yourself in their shoes, and acknowledge their emotions both verbally and non-verbally through body language or facial expressions.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm a new way to use toothpicks.
samples.input: Brainstorm a new way to use toothpicks.
samples.output: One innovative way to use toothpicks could be to create a small, portable art kit. Toothpicks come in many sizes and shapes, so they could be used to create intricate designs or patterns on small surfaces. A little paint, some glue and a handful of toothpicks could be a great tool for spontaneous art on the go, creating mini toothpick sculptures, abstract work or even intricate geometric designs. They could also be used as a stamping tool, dipping the pointed or flat ends into paint and then drawing or dotting onto paper. This would be a fun and creative way to use toothpicks, and it would offer a new outlet for artistic expression.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm 5 ways a company can reduce their losses.
samples.input: Brainstorm 5 ways a company can reduce their losses.
samples.output:
1. Identifying and Addressing Unprofitable Areas: A company can reduce losses by conducting an extensive analysis of their operations and identifying any areas that are consistently unprofitable. Once identified, the company can take measures to either improve the performance of those areas, or possibly cut or reduce them.

2. Cost Reduction: Companies can also reduce losses by implementing cost reduction strategies that target expenses across the organization. This might include negotiating better terms with suppliers, streamlining processes to reduce waste, downsizing the workforce, or reducing employee benefits.

3. Increase Revenue: Another way to reduce losses is to focus on increasing revenue. This can be achieved through expanding the customer base, increasing sales, developing new products or services, and raising prices.

4. Debt Management: Managing debt effectively is another way to minimize losses. This can be accomplished by paying off high-interest debts, consolidating debts, or negotiating better terms for outstanding loans.

5. Regular Monitoring and Forecasting: To avoid significant losses, companies should have a robust monitoring and forecasting system in place. This system can help identify any potential financial pitfalls, and allow the company to take corrective action before significant losses are incurred. By staying on top of the company’s financial health, losses can be kept to a minimum.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm five creative ways to use the item
samples.input: Brainstorm five creative ways to use the item Paper
samples.output:
1. Origami: One creative way to use paper is to try the traditional Japanese art of paper folding known as "Origami" to create beautiful, intricate 3D designs such as animals, flowers or other objects.

2. Scrapbooking: Another way to use paper creatively is in scrapbooking. Paper can be used to design pages for photos, ticket stubs, and other memorabilia, decorate them with vibrant paper cutouts, borders and embellishments also made out of paper.

3. Papercraft: Paper can be used to create 3D models or sculpture, including everything from architectural models to pop-up books, paper toys, decorations and even wearable art such as paper jewelry, masks or hats.

4. Paper quilling: Also known as paper filigree, this technique involves rolling, shaping and gluing thin strips of paper together to create intricate, textured designs. Quilling can be used to make everything from greeting cards and framed art to jewelry and home decor.

5. Homemade Stationary: With some creativity, paper can be turned into beautiful homemade stationery. By using techniques such as stamping, embossing, watercolor or calligraphy, you can make stunning personalized cards, invitations or notepads.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm a way to reduce deforestation.
samples.input: Brainstorm a way to reduce deforestation.
samples.output: One way to reduce deforestation is to implement sustainable forestry practices. This can include measures such as selective cutting (harvesting only mature trees and leaving younger ones intact), maintaining buffer zones around bodies of water, and reducing clearcutting (where all trees in a given area are removed) in favor of more selective methods. Additionally, enforcing strict regulatory measures and providing economic incentives to companies that adhere to sustainable practices can encourage responsible and sustainable forest management. Another approach is to promote alternatives to deforestation-driven industries, such as agriculture, by expanding opportunities for sustainable income generation, such as ecotourism, agroforestry, and conservation-related jobs. Finally, increasing public awareness and promoting conservation education can help foster a culture of responsible land use and build support for sustainable forestry practices.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm new ways to use technology to save time.
samples.input: Brainstorm new ways to use technology to save time.
samples.output:
1. Automating Household Chores: Utilizing robot vacuums, mops, and lawn mowers to complete household tasks, allowing individuals to focus on other activities.

2. Voice Activation and Control: Use of smart home devices such as Amazon Alexa or Google Home to control home automation systems, allowing individuals to complete tasks such as turning on/off lights, adjusting the temperature, and even making grocery lists without having to stop what they are doing.

3. Virtual Meetings and Telecommuting: Offering more opportunities for virtual meetings and telecommuting to save time and money on commuting and travel.

4. AI-Enabled Personal Assistants: Development of advanced AI personal assistants that can assist in tasks such as scheduling appointments, making reservations, and organizing tasks and to-do lists.

5. Delivery Drones: Utilizing delivery drones for faster and more efficient delivery of goods, eliminating the need for time-consuming trips to the store.

6. Virtual Shopping: Development of advanced virtual shopping platforms, allowing individuals to try on clothes and make purchases from the comfort of their own home.

7. Smart Transportation: Implementation of smart transportation systems, utilizing real-time data to optimize travel routes and reduce commute times.

8. Automated Bill Payments: Development of systems for automating bill payments, eliminating the need to manually pay bills each month.

9. Remote Healthcare: Use of telemedicine and remote monitoring to allow individuals to receive medical care from the comfort of their own home, reducing the need for time-consuming trips to the doctor.

10. Advanced AI Learning: Development of advanced AI learning systems that can help individuals learn new skills and information more quickly, reducing the time needed for education and training.

samples.instruction: Brainstorm three ways to become eco-friendly.
samples.input: Brainstorm three ways to become eco-friendly.
samples.output:
1. Reduce, reuse, and recycle: The first and foremost way to become eco-friendly is by reducing waste production, reusing items instead of throwing them away, and recycling materials such as paper, plastic, and glass. By practicing these three Rs, individuals and communities can significantly decrease the amount of waste that ends up in landfills and help preserve natural resources.

2. Conserve energy and water: Another way to become eco-friendly is by conserving energy and water. Simple actions such as turning off lights when leaving a room, unplugging appliances when not in use, and taking shorter showers can help reduce energy and water consumption. Additionally, using energy-efficient light bulbs and appliances can also help conserve energy and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

3. Use sustainable transportation: The third way to become eco-friendly is by using sustainable modes of transportation such as walking, biking, or taking public transportation. These modes of transportation not only help reduce carbon emissions, but also help improve air quality and reduce traffic congestion. For longer trips, carpooling or using electric or hybrid vehicles is also a more eco-friendly option than driving a gas-powered car alone.

"carried, he, happily, balloons"
samples.output: He happily carried balloons.

samples.instruction: Outline the main points of a persuasive speech on the importance of environmental sustainability.
samples.input: Outline the main points of a persuasive speech on the importance of environmental sustainability.
samples.output:
I. Introduction
A. Attention getter: Use a thought-provoking fact or statement about the impact of environmental degradation.
B. Importance of the topic: Explain why environmental sustainability is crucial to our future.
C. Thesis statement: Present the main argument that it is our responsibility to take care of the environment for future generations.
D. Preview: Offer a brief overview of the points that will be discussed in the speech.

II. Body
A. Define environmental sustainability: Provide a clear definition and explain what it entails.
B. Highlight the consequences of inaction: Describe the adverse effects of not taking care of the environment, such as climate change, loss of biodiversity, and pollution.
C. Discuss the benefits of sustainability: Outline the positive outcomes of environmental protection, including improved health, a more robust economy, and a thriving natural world.
D. Call to action: Encourage the audience to take steps to live sustainably, such as reducing waste, conserving resources, and supporting conservation efforts.

III. Conclusion
A. Summarize the main points of the speech
B. Reinforce the thesis statement: Remind the audience of the overarching argument of the speech.
C. End with a powerful statement: Encourage the audience to take action and make a difference for the environment.

samples.instruction: Outline the main points for the article given.
samples.input: Outline the main points for the article given. The article is about the development of a new medical technology
samples.output:
1) Introduction to the new medical technology in development. 

2) Description of the technology, explaining how it works, and its intended use.

3) Discussion on the potential impact of the new technology on the medical field and patient care.

4) Information about the team behind the development, including their expertise and credentials.

5) Overview of the stages of development and current progress.

6) Insights on future plans for testing, trials, and rollout of the technology.

7) Conclusion summarizing the significance and potential of the new medical technology.

samples.instruction: Outline the main points of a presentation about the benefits of renewable energy.
samples.input: Outline the main points of a presentation about the benefits of renewable energy.
samples.output:
1. Environmental benefits: Unlike fossil fuels, renewable energy sources do not produce harmful emissions, thus reducing air pollution and promoting a healthier environment.

2. Sustainability: Renewable energy sources such as wind, solar, hydro, and geothermal power are practically infinite or replenishable, unlike nonrenewable sources such as oil and gas, which will eventually run out.

3. Cost-effective: Renewable energy technologies have become increasingly cost-effective, allowing for long-term economic benefits. With no fuel costs, investment in renewable energy sources can eventually pay for itself.

4. Energy independence: By utilizing local renewable energy sources, countries can reduce their dependence on foreign oil and gas, enhancing energy security and reducing the risk of supply disruption.

5. Job creation: The renewable energy sector is a significant source of job creation, providing employment opportunities for workers in various fields such as manufacturing, installation, and maintenance.

6. Climate change mitigation: Renewable energy sources produce little to no greenhouse gas emissions, thereby reducing the overall carbon footprint and helping to mitigate climate change.

7. Innovation and technological advancement: The development and implementation of renewable energy technologies foster innovation and promote technological advancement, driving progress in various fields.

8. Consumer empowerment: With the growing popularity of domestic solar panels and wind turbines, consumers can produce their own electricity and even sell excess power back to the grid, providing a level of independence and empowerment.

9. Positive impact on local communities: Renewable energy projects can have a positive impact on local communities, by providing benefits such as tax revenues, improved infrastructure, and economic development.

10. Governments' support: Many governments around the world have set ambitious renewable energy targets and are providing incentives to promote the adoption of clean energy technologies, making the switch to renewables more accessible and cost-effective for individuals and businesses.

samples.instruction: Outline the main points about the given topic in two paragraphs.
samples.input: Outline the main points about the given topic in two paragraphs. The Benefits of Hybrid Cars
samples.output:
Hybrid cars are vehicles that combine the functionality of an internal combustion engine and at least one electric motor. One of the main benefits of hybrid cars is that they often have greater fuel efficiency, translating to cost savings for the vehicle owner over time. They also produce less emissions than traditional cars that rely solely on gas, helping to reduce their environmental impact. This can be especially beneficial in urban areas where air pollution is a major problem.

Another advantage of hybrid cars is that they provide considerable power and often have quick acceleration. They achieve this by utilizing their electric motor in addition to their internal combustion engine. For commuters who have to drive on highways or busy city streets, this extra boost can be really helpful. Additionally, the shift between the electric motor and the gas engine is generally smooth, resulting in a more comfortable driving experience. Overall, the numerous benefits of hybrid cars make them an increasingly popular choice for drivers looking for a dependable, sustainable, and cost-saving transportation solution.

samples.instruction: Outline the major points of the US Constitution.
samples.input: Outline the major points of the US Constitution.
samples.output:
The United States Constitution is the most important document in American government and history which provides the legal framework for the federal government, as well as sets forth the rights and liberties of the American people. Here are the major points of the US Constitution:

1. Preamble: The preamble to the Constitution outlines the purposes of the document and the powers of the new federal government.

2. Separation of Powers: The Constitution separates the powers of government into the three branches; the Legislative, Executive, and Judicial branches, which prevents any single branch from becoming too powerful.

3. Checks and Balances: The branches of government are given specific checks and balances over each other to ensure that no one branch becomes too powerful.

4. Federalism: The Constitution delineates the relationship between the federal government and the state governments, which allows the states some autonomy while still having a strong national government.

5. Bill of Rights: The first 10 amendments to the Constitution, known as the Bill of Rights, outline the basic rights and freedoms of all American citizens such as freedom of speech, religion, and the press, as well as protections against unreasonable searches and seizures, and cruel and unusual punishment.

6. Constitutional Amendments: The Constitution can be changed through the amendment process, which allows for the addition of new amendments or the repeal of existing ones. There are currently 27 amendments to the Constitution.

7. Supremacy Clause: The Constitution, federal laws, and treaties made under its authority are considered the supreme law of the land, meaning that state laws cannot conflict with federal laws or the Constitution.

Overall, the US Constitution has stood the test of time, and its principles continue to serve as the bedrock of the American system of government.

samples.instruction: Outline the main points in a speech about air pollution.
samples.input: Outline the main points in a speech about air pollution.
samples.output:
1. Definition and explanation of air pollution: beginning the speech by explaining what air pollution is, and its effects on the atmosphere.
2. Overview of primary pollutants: a brief discussion of the main sources of pollutants, including particulate matter, nitrogen oxides, sulfur oxides, carbon monoxide, and volatile organic compounds.
3. Causes of air pollution: an overview of the primary human activities that contribute to air pollution, including vehicular emissions, industrial processes, burning fossil fuels, and deforestation, among others.
4. Health and environmental effects of air pollution: discussion of the negative impacts air pollution has on human health, such as respiratory and cardiovascular diseases, as well as its damaging effects on the environment, including climate change, acid rain, and disruption of ecosystems.
5. Solutions and actions to mitigate air pollution: presenting measures that can be taken, such as transitioning to renewable energy sources, improving air quality standards, increasing public transportation usage and, promoting energy conservation efforts. Encouraging individual actions like reducing car use, conserving energy and minimizing personal carbon footprint.

samples.instruction: Outline the main points of an argument against the use of private vehicles
samples.input: Outline the main points of an argument against the use of private vehicles
samples.output:
1. Negative environmental impact: Private vehicles are a major source of air pollution and greenhouse gas emissions contributing significantly to climate change.

2. Traffic congestion: With the increase in population and urbanization, the use of private vehicles has led to traffic congestion, causing longer travel times and reduced air quality in cities.

3. Inefficient use of resources: Private vehicles are often underutilized with only one or two passengers per car, resulting in wasteful consumption of fuel and road space. 

4. High costs: The costs of owning and maintaining a private vehicle, including insurance, fuel, maintenance, and parking fees can be prohibitively expensive for many individuals.

5. Safety concerns: The use of private vehicles, particularly cars and motorcycles, can be dangerous due to the risk of accidents and injury on the roads.

6. Alternatives exist: There are many alternatives to private vehicles, including public transportation, walking, cycling, or car sharing, which can be cheaper, healthier, and more sustainable options.

7. Encourages urban sprawl: The widespread use of private vehicles enables and encourages urban sprawl, leading to the development of car-dependent neighborhoods, with negative impacts on social cohesion and access to essential services.

8. Limited availability of parking: As the number of private vehicles increase, the availability of parking decreases, leading to increased parking fees, and inconvenience for vehicle owners.

In conclusion, the use of private vehicles has numerous negative impacts on the environment, society, and individual wellbeing. Instead, we should be promoting sustainable and active transportation options to reduce our reliance on private vehicles.

samples.instruction: Outline the main points of a speech on green energy.
samples.input: Outline the main points of a speech on green energy.
samples.output:
Ladies and gentlemen, I am honored to be here today to talk about a topic that is of utmost importance to our planet: green energy. In this speech, I will outline the main points of why we should all be focused on transitioning to green energy and what measures can be taken to do so. 

Firstly, let's define what green energy is. Green energy is renewable energy that comes from natural sources, like sunlight, wind or water, and is often produced with minimal, or even no, environmental impact. 

The first point to discuss is the environmental impact of fossil fuels. Fossil fuels, like oil, coal and natural gas, still account for the majority of the world's energy consumption, despite being known for their harmful impact on the environment. Burning fossil fuels releases huge amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, accelerating global warming and causing devastating climate change. 

In contrast, green energy sources, like wind turbines or solar panels, generate electricity without releasing harmful carbon emissions. By producing and consuming more green energy, we can dramatically reduce our carbon footprint and combat climate change.

Another important point to note is the instability of non-renewable energy supplies. Unlike renewable sources which will always be available, fossil fuels are finite and will eventually run out. This means that energy prices and supply are subject to sudden fluctuations, causing uncertainty and instability. Green energy, however, can provide a constant, reliable supply, and make us less reliant on imports.

Finally, I would like to discuss the economic benefits of green energy. Transitioning to green energy will be a huge engine for job growth and will generate significant new investments in the economy. Green energy jobs, like installing solar panels or wind turbines, are largely local, provide stable employment and bolster economic development in rural communities. Moreover, green energy can insulate consumers from volatile energy prices, saving them money in the long run.

In summary, transitioning to green energy is essential for the sustainability of our planet, is a more reliable source of energy, and has significant economic benefits for all. Let's all work towards a greener future. Thank you.

samples.instruction: Outline the main points of the following lecture.
samples.input: Outline the main points of the following lecture. Today we are discussing the causes, effects and solutions to climate change.
samples.output:
This lecture discusses three key components of climate change: its causes, effects and solutions.

Main points:
- Causes of climate change: discussing factors such as greenhouse gas emissions, deforestation, and human activities that contribute to the rise in global temperature.
- Effects of climate change: the impact of rising temperatures on the environment and ecosystems, including melting ice caps and rising sea levels, extreme weather events, and loss of biodiversity.
- Solutions to climate change: various measures that can be taken to mitigate the effects of climate change, including reducing greenhouse gas emissions, switching to sustainable energy sources, and promoting sustainable practices.

samples.instruction: Outline the three main points in the opinion piece
samples.input: Outline the three main points in the opinion piece Outsourcing jobs to cheaper overseas labor is often seen as bad but, in certain circumstances, it may be beneficial to nations and workers alike.
samples.output:
1. The common view of outsourcing jobs to overseas labor is that it is negative. 
2. However, there are situations where outsourcing can bring benefits. 
3. These advantages may occur for both the countries involved and the labor force.

samples.instruction: Outline the key points made in the paper.
samples.input: Outline the key points made in the paper. A paper about the impact of television news on public opinion.
samples.output:
Here are some possible key points made in a paper about the impact of television news on public opinion:

1. Television news can have a significant impact on shaping public opinion, as it is one of the most easily accessible sources of information for many people.

2. The way that news stories are reported, including the framing of the story, the language used, and the images shown, can influence how viewers perceive the issue at hand.

3. The amount of airtime given to a particular story and the selection of the news itself can also affect public opinion  as it can reflect an agenda-setting on news networks.

4. Television news anchors and reporters often have their own biases and opinions, which can influence how they present the news and the stories they choose to cover.

5. Public opinion can be swayed by the tone of the coverage as well, such as sensationalized or alarmist reporting.

6. The paper might provide empirical evidence to support the assertion that there is a correlation between television news coverage and changes in public opinion.

7. There could also be a discussion on the potential social and political consequences of this impact of television news on public opinion, and the need for responsible journalism.

samples.instruction: Outline the main points of a webinar discussion on the given topic.
samples.input: Outline the main points of a webinar discussion on the given topic. Networking Basics
samples.output:
1. Introduction to networking: Defining what a network is and why networking is important in today’s digital world.

2. Types of networks: Explaining the different types of networks, such as the internet, intranets, extranets, Wide Area Networks (WAN), and Local Area Networks (LAN)

3. Network architectures: A discussion on the various types of network architectures, including client-server, peer-to-peer, and cloud networking.

4. Network protocols: An explanation of common network protocols, such as TCP/IP, HTTP, and FTP, and their roles in facilitating communication between devices.

5. Network devices: An overview of the various network devices including routers, switches, hubs, and modems.

6. Network security: A discussion on the importance of securing networks against cyber-attacks, and common threats such as viruses, worms, and Trojans.

7. Best Practices: Tips for setting up and maintaining a reliable, efficient, and secure network.

8. Conclusion: Summing up the key takeaways from the webinar and providing resources for further learning.

samples.instruction: Outline the main points of a speech about the effects of climate change
samples.input: Outline the main points of a speech about the effects of climate change
samples.output:
1. Introduction: Begin by stating the significance and importance of addressing climate change as a global concern that affects humanity and the environment.

2. Overview: Provide an overview of climate change, including its causes, such as greenhouse gas emissions from human activities, and the main indicators such as global temperature rise, melting of polar ice caps, and rising sea levels.

3. Impacts on Ecosystems: Discuss the effects of climate change on ecosystems and wildlife, including changes in migration patterns, loss of habitats, and extinction of species.

4. Impacts on Society: Highlight the social and economic effects of climate change, including changes in agricultural productivity, water availability, natural disasters, and displacement of populations.

5. Actions to Mitigate Climate Change: Address the measures that can be taken to mitigate climate change, including reducing greenhouse gas emissions, transitioning to renewable energy sources, promoting sustainable land use practices, and improving energy efficiency.

6. The Role of Governments: Discuss the important role of governments in implementing policies to address climate change, including setting emissions targets, implementing carbon pricing, investing in renewable energy, and promoting international cooperation.

7. The Role of Individuals: Highlight the ongoing role of individuals in reducing their carbon footprint through making lifestyle changes such as using public transport, reducing energy consumption, and supporting sustainable practices.

8. Conclusion: Sum up the importance of immediate and collaborative action to address the effects of climate change and emphasize the need for continued efforts to mitigate and adapt to its impacts.

samples.instruction: Extract the key dates and events in the life of Albert Einstein in a bulleted list in the format {date} - {event}
samples.input:
Extract the key dates and events in the life of Albert Einstein in a bulleted list in the format {date} - {event} Einstein was born in the German Empire, but moved to Switzerland in 1895, forsaking his German citizenship (as a subject of the Kingdom of Württemberg)[note 1] the following year. In 1897, at the age of 17, he enrolled in the mathematics and physics teaching diploma program at the Swiss Federal polytechnic school in Zürich, graduating in 1900. In 1901, he acquired Swiss citizenship, which he kept for the rest of his life, and in 1903 he secured a permanent position at the Swiss Patent Office in Bern. In 1905, he was awarded a PhD by the University of Zurich. In 1914, Einstein moved to Berlin in order to join the Prussian Academy of Sciences and the Humboldt University of Berlin. In 1917, Einstein became director of the Kaiser Wilhelm Institute for Physics; he also became a German citizen again, this time Prussian.

In 1933, while Einstein was visiting the United States, Adolf Hitler came to power in Germany. Einstein, as a Jew, objected to the policies of the newly elected Nazi government; he settled in the United States and became an American citizen in 1940. On the eve of World War II, he endorsed a letter to President Franklin D. Roosevelt alerting him to the potential German nuclear weapons program and recommending that the US begin similar research. Einstein supported the Allies but generally denounced the idea of nuclear weapons.
samples.output:
1895 - Moved to Switzerland
1897 - Enrolled in the mathematics and physics teaching diploma program at the Swiss Federal polytechnic school in Zürich
1900 - Graduated from the mathematics and physics teaching diploma program at the Swiss Federal polytechnic school
1901 - Became a Swiss citizen
1903 - Started a permanent position at the Swiss Patent Office in Bern
1905 - Awarded a PhD by the University of Zurich
1914 - Moved to Berlin to join the Prussian Academy of Sciences and the Humboldt University of Berlin
1917 - Became the director of the Kaiser Wilhelm Institute for Physics
1917 - Became a German citizen again
1933 - Settled in the United States
1940 - Became an American citizen

samples.instruction: Extract all the dates from this paragraph provided.
samples.input:
Extract all the dates from this paragraph provided. The New Joint Endeavor for Welfare, Education, and Liberation, or New JEWEL Movement (NJM), was a Marxist–Leninist vanguard party in the Caribbean island nation of Grenada that was led by Maurice Bishop.

Established in 1973, the NJM issued its manifesto prior to the granting of independence to Grenada in 1974. The movement took control of the country with a successful bloodless revolution in 1979 and ruled by decree as the People's Revolutionary Government until 1983. In 1983, Bishop was killed by paramilitaries affiliated with hard-liners in his own party. This led to a military government, which was deposed by the US military in a 1983 invasion.

samples.instruction: Explain how you would teach someone about the importance of punctuality.
samples.input: Task: Explain how you would teach someone about the importance of punctuality.

For example, if you are late for work, you may get fired or demoted. If you are late for an important meeting, you may miss out on a great opportunity. I would also explain that it is not just about being on time, but also about being early. I would tell them to be at least 10 minutes early for every appointment and event. This will allow them to relax and prepare themselves before the event starts.

samples.instruction: How would you teach someone to do the following task: 1) make eggs; 2) use chopsticks; 3) fold a fitted sheet.
samples.input:
How would you teach someone to do the following task: 1) make eggs; 2) use chopsticks; 3) fold a fitted sheet.
Output:
samples.output:
1) Crack an egg into a bowl. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mix with a fork until the yolk is broken.
2) Hold the chopsticks in your dominant hand, with the tips resting on the table. Use your other hand to grasp one of the chopsticks. Move it back and forth between your thumb and index finger. This will loosen up the chopstick so that you can use it more easily.
3) Lay the fitted sheet flat on the bed. Fold the bottom corner up about two inches. Then fold the top corner down about two inches. Continue folding the sheet in this manner until it is completely folded.

samples.instruction: Read the following passage and then explain which type of literary point of view is used (e.g., first person, second person, third person limited, or third person omniscient).
samples.input: Read the following passage and then explain which type of literary point of view is used (e.g., first person, second person, third person limited, or third person omniscient). Lena sat at the kitchen table, sipping her tea and watching the raindrops slide down the windowpane. She thought about how she would go to the store when the rain stopped. She had never been fond of umbrellas, no matter how practical they were. Lena knew Jake would laugh at her stubbornness, always refusing to use an umbrella, but she didn't care. Unbeknownst to her, Jake felt the same way about umbrellas.
samples.output: The type of literary point of view used in this passage is third person limited. The reader has access to Lena's thoughts, feelings, and perspectives, but not to Jake's. The mention of Jake's feelings on umbrellas is only Lena's assumption, rather than knowing his thoughts directly, which would indicate third person omniscient.

samples.instruction: Explain why it is not possible to use "any" and "all" interchangeably in the following sentence: all dogs are mammals, but any dog can be a mammal.
samples.input: Explain why it is not possible to use "any" and "all" interchangeably in the following sentence: all dogs are mammals, but any dog can be a mammal.
samples.output:
All dogs are mammals, but any dog can be a mammal.
This sentence is incorrect because "any" and "all" have different meanings. The word "any" means at least one of the things in the group, while the word "all" means all of the things in the group. For example, if you say "I want to buy any book", it means that you want to buy at least one book. However, if you say "I want to buy all books", it means that you want to buy all the books.

The following situation illustrates how stereotypes can lead to discrimination. A man walks into a bar and sees three men sitting at the counter. He approaches them and asks, "How many of you are there?" One of the men replies, "There are three of us." The man then says, "I thought so. You see, I have this problem. Every time I meet a group of people, I always count them. So, if you’ll excuse me, I’ll just go back to my table and count you all again."
samples.output: The man was counting on the fact that most groups of three people will include one person who is Asian. This stereotype led him to believe that the group he encountered would be no different. However, his assumption was wrong, and he ended up embarrassing himself in front of the group.

samples.instruction: Formulate a hypothesis about the relation between income and happiness
samples.input: Formulate a hypothesis about the relation between income and happiness
samples.output: One possible hypothesis about the relation between income and happiness is that there is a positive correlation between the two, meaning that individuals with higher incomes tend to report higher levels of happiness. However, it is also possible that this relationship may plateau at a certain income threshold, beyond which additional income may not significantly impact happiness.

samples.instruction: Formulate a hypothesis for why some animals migrate.
samples.input: Formulate a hypothesis for why some animals migrate.
samples.output: One possible hypothesis for why some animals migrate could be that migration is a survival strategy that allows these animals to move to new areas to find better resources, such as food or suitable habitat, or to escape unfavorable conditions, such as harsh winter weather or drought. Migration could also help increase their chances of finding mates, avoiding predation, and ensuring the survival of their offspring.

samples.instruction: Formulate a valid hypothesis for the following question.

samples.instruction: Formulate a hypothesis about the relationship between social media use and mental health.
samples.input: Formulate a hypothesis about the relationship between social media use and mental health.
samples.output: One possible hypothesis is that increased social media use is associated with a higher risk of developing negative mental health outcomes, such as anxiety or depression. This may be due to the fact that social media can promote unrealistic expectations and comparisons with others, leading to feelings of inadequacy and low self-esteem among users. Additionally, excessive screen time spent on social media may lead to social isolation and decreased face-to-face interactions, further exacerbating mental health issues. Of course, this is just one possible hypothesis and further research is needed to establish the relationship between social media use and mental health.

samples.instruction: Formulate a hypothesis for a given experiment.

samples.output: Hypothesis: The application of fertilizer will lead to an increase in plant growth, as measured by an increase in height, number of leaves, and overall biomass of the plants, when compared to plants that do not receive fertilizer.

samples.instruction: Formulate a hypothesis on the effectiveness of Vitamin C on the common cold.
samples.input: Formulate a hypothesis on the effectiveness of Vitamin C on the common cold.
samples.output: One potential hypothesis on the effectiveness of Vitamin C on the common cold is that regular intake of Vitamin C can reduce the duration and severity of symptoms of the common cold. This could be due to Vitamin C's immune-boosting properties, which may help the body fight off cold-causing viruses more effectively.

samples.instruction: Formulate a hypothesis to explain why part of the population is more vulnerable to COVID-19
samples.input: Formulate a hypothesis to explain why part of the population is more vulnerable to COVID-19
samples.output: One possible hypothesis to explain why part of the population is more vulnerable to COVID-19 is that certain pre-existing health conditions, such as diabetes, hypertension, or respiratory illnesses, make an individual more susceptible to severe symptoms and complications from the virus. Additionally, age could be a factor, as older adults may have weaker immune systems and may also have a higher likelihood of having pre-existing conditions. Another possibility is that certain genetic or biological factors may put certain individuals at greater risk. Additionally, socio-economic status and access to healthcare could play a role, as individuals living in poverty or with limited access to healthcare may have a harder time getting proper treatment and preventing the spread of the virus within their communities.

samples.instruction: Formulate a hypothesis about brain development
samples.input: Formulate a hypothesis about brain development
samples.output: One possible hypothesis about brain development is that the different experiences and stimuli a person is exposed to, particularly during the critical periods of brain growth, can greatly influence the neural connections and pathways that form in the brain. This suggests that the environments, relationships, and experiences of early childhood have a significant impact on shaping cognitive, social, and emotional development throughout an individual's life.

samples.instruction: Formulate a hypothesis based on given information.
